data.title: MindFlower Group
data.text:
Winifred Allen, M.S, LMFT, QMHP, QMHCM, QSACM, CISM is a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist who holds a Master of Science in Counseling, Marriage Family & Child Therapy, and a Bachelor of Arts in Political Science/Pre-Law. Winifred has multiple certifications: QMHP (Qualified Mental Health Provider), QMHCM (Qualified Mental Health Case Manager), QSACM (Qualified Substance Abuse Case Manager), Clinical Supervision Training, Advanced Clinical Supervision Training, and CISM (Critical Incident Stress Management). Winifred has extensive knowledge and experience working with Youth & Families in an outpatient setting, community mental health, The forensic population, court ordered offenders, the serious persistent mentally ill, critical incidents, substance abuse/alcohol, drug court, probation & law enforcement, crisis stabilization, crisis & hostage situations, and National Security. Winifred has also held a T/S clearance. Winifred has a long history of fighting for Social Justice, as a Director and Executive Board Member with Federal, County, and State Unions. Winifred fights for Employee Rights & Benefits, Fair Wages, Safety Issues, Social Justice, Voting Rights, and Criminal Justice Reform. Winifred is also a member of several civic and social organizations that promote equality and equity for all individuals. It is Winifredâ€™s belief that in some communities, individuals experience more trauma or severe life stressors, that cause unhealthy responses, emotional stress, and distress. Some stressors present as financial, economic problems, poverty, violence, housing needs, microaggression, violence, abuse, no or limited access to medical care, legal problems, low education, or lack of education. Constant societal & civil unrest, and the graphic images of racism affect the psychopathology and brain, which cause emotional reactions known as trauma responses. Physical symptoms such as headaches, digestive problems, fatigue, racing heart, nightmares, recalling memories, and avoidance, are signs that the mental, emotional, and body, are not well. Winifred uses several therapeutic modalities such as Solution Focused Brief Therapy, Crisis Intervention/ Motivational Interviewing, Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT), Functional Family Therapy (FFT), Multigenerational Family Therapy, Trauma Focused Therapy, Structural Family Therapy, Existential Family Therapy, Narrative Therapy, Play Therapy, Individual and Group Therapy to address family, child problems, community and individual needs. At MindFlower Group, Winifred provides counseling and therapy services.

Dr. Dees, LPC, MFT, PhD completed her Bachelor of Science at UNC Greensboro. She then completed the Masterâ€™s in Marriage and Family Therapy (MFT) at Virginia Tech. Immediately after finishing the MFT program she enrolled in Howard University, where she completed her second Masterâ€™s Degree in Counseling Psychology. After leaving Howard her she completed her doctorate in Counseling Psychology. JEMEG Dees is also a Licensed Professional Counselor. Her focus is on working with minority populations, and she specializes in working with African American couples and families. Her focus is resiliency, relationship improvement, and identity development. She uses a culturally sensitive modality for mental health counseling and psychotherapy. Dr. Dees has worked in a variety of settings, including the military, juvenile detention centers, outpatient treatment centers, residential treatment centers and private practice. Dr. Dees experience includes work with a history of abuse, the seriously mentally ill, military families, incarcerated persons, and people struggling with addiction. At MindFlower Group, Dr Dees will provide counseling and therapy services.

Mayra Figueroa-Clark, LICSW is passionate about dispelling the mental illness stigma and elevating mental health professionals. As a clinical psychotherapist, she empowers, young adults, individuals, small groups; specializing in trauma, vicarious trauma, anxiety and depression. She uses experimental workshops, overcoming trauma through a mindfulness lens, CBT systems theory, EMDR, DBT and psychoeducation. She also offers therapy for those grappling with stress reduction, work-life balance, and executive functioning.

Throughout her 24 years of clinical work, Mayra is creative, intuitive, compassionate, and bold. She often uses practical strategies with the foundation of a strength-based philosophy. Her professional experience spans from providing treatment or advocacy in courtrooms to hospital care, her own private practice, a school-based mental health provider, clinical supervision and most recently facilitating trainings/workshops on trauma-informed and vicarious trauma (REAL self-care) practices for other mental health professionals. At MindFlower Group, Ms. Figueroa-Clark provides supervision and counseling and therapy services.

Danielle Nelson LICSW is committed to serving at-risk families in the District of Columbia as a licensed independent clinical social worker and a certified clinical trauma professional. Danielle has over 15 years of social work experience working with families who have faced a myriad of obstacles that were transformed into opportunities. She has served in schools, substance abuse treatment facilities, transitional housing programs, foster care agencies, community-based organizations, crisis centers, and court settings. Danielle is a natural optimist, and she believes that her faith and resilience are her greatest resources. She enjoys helping others with a smile while promoting wellness while mentoring new mental health professionals. At MindFlower Group, Ms. Nelson provides clinical supervision and consults on regulatory compliance.

Brittany Young, LICSW is a true clinician at heart: an LICSW in D.C. and a LCSW-C in Maryland. Brittany is energetic and comes with a wealth of knowledge having worked as a direct service provider, therapist, manager, and consultant for over 10 years. She truly enjoys teaching and helping to improve the skill set of licensed and unlicensed providers to enhance the therapeutic alliance between a client and therapist. Brittany is dedicated to understanding how trauma has an intergenerational impact on an individual and developing ways to end the trauma cycle. Brittany thrives in where she can use her clinical skills to benefit the overall well-being of underserved communities. At MindFlower Group, Ms. Brittany provides clinical supervision.

Alvin Smith, MSW The dedicated therapist is committed to helping individuals live purposeful and fulfilling lives. Possessing a Master of Social Work (MSW) from the University of Southern

California and a Master in Public Administration (MPA) from Eastern Washington

University, they have a comprehensive understanding of human behavior and social

dynamics.

Having embarked on a professional journey in individual therapy, workforce

development, higher education, and military service, their perspective has been

profoundly influenced, instilling a deep appreciation for diverse experiences. As a gay

individual, they bring a unique vantage point to their practice, fostering inclusivity.

Known for resilience, encouragement, and reliability, the therapist's approach is

intertwined with their personality. They firmly believe in establishing a strong

partnership with clients, working collaboratively using cognitive-behavioral therapy

(CBT) to promote positive change. Having lived as a Black American in various regions

and internationally, they embrace cultural diversity in therapy.

The therapeutic alliance, built on trust and empathy, forms the foundation for growth.

The therapist's life and treatment philosophies align, emphasizing resilience and self-

compassion. As a mental health professional, their goal is to provide tools and support

for clients to rediscover their inner resources.

Being a supportive friend, lifelong learner, and mental health advocate contributes to

their empathy in therapy. They chose this profession out of genuine love for people and

belief in their potential. Witnessing clients break free, embrace their true selves, and

grow brings them immense joy. Making a positive impact on someone's life is a

privilege, and witnessing their resilience and potential is truly humbling.

Mrs. Indria Savoy, LICSW, LCSW is licensed in the District of Columbia and Virginia. She holds a Bachelorâ€™s of Art degree in Criminal Justice from Virginia Union University and a Masterâ€™s of Social Work degree from Howard University. Indria has over 12+ years of experience working with diverse groups of underserved individuals in the community, hospital, prison and government settings. She specializes in working with adults who are in need of support with managing various mental, emotional and social challenges. Mrs. Savoyâ€™s style is strengths based, collaborative, honest, creative, humorous and solution focused. She draws from Narrative Therapy, Cognitive Behavioral Therapy, Dialectical Behavioral Therapy and Motivational Interviewing. Matching her skill set with your needs, she hopes to partner with you on creating a treatment plan that addresses your areas of concern. Mrs. Savoy aspires to continue bridging the mental health gap by offering quality mental health support to underserved communities..

Ebony Bland LMSW Ebony is a Licensed Master of Social Work with advanced training in Mental Health. She is committed to

maintaining a diverse, equitable and inclusive practice, which serves individuals of all identities and

orientations. Ebony has a particular niche when building trust and developing therapeutic alliances with

children and teens but is well versed in providing intervention for clients in all phases of life. Her clients

are often challenged with navigating anxiety, depression, work-life balance and establishing boundaries

for themselves within their various roles and relationships. Ebony approach is an integrated approach

that combines Cognitive Behavioral and Humanistic therapeutic techniques. She is passionate about her

clientâ€™s achieving self-actualization. Ebonyâ€™s style is interactive, progressive and seeks to assist clients in

realizing their true potential. Ebony is extremely dedicated to helping clients develop a sense of purpose

and sustain their wellbeing. Ebony believes in giving homework to promote critical thinking and

application of techniques utilized in session. Additionally, as a trauma-informed therapist, Ebony is

sensitive to the impact of past experiences on the present and works with the client to develop effective

coping habits that will serve them in the future.

Patricia Moise LCSW focuses her practice on the field of mental health and has developed a specialty in this area. 2015 was the year that she graduated from Monmouth University with a Master of Social Work degree. She is enrolled in a doctoral degree in the field of social work. She has more than five years of experience dealing with veterans who are homeless as well as those who suffer from severe mental illness. Her primary objective is to make certain that young people and adults have access to the knowledge, tools, and opportunities they need to properly care for themselves and their families. She approaches her job in an all-encompassing, attentive, and culturally sensitive manner in order to guarantee that her clients get the required support for which they have been looking. She has received training in the methods of mindful meditation, cognitive behavioral therapy, motivational interviewing, and nurtured heart parenting. As a result of this, she is able to guide clients through the process of making small but crucial adjustments to their lives in a manner that is both aware and supportive.

Ms. Sacorra B. Hepburn, Psychology Associate, specializes in counseling and mental health assessments with children, teens, emerging adults, and adults. Throughout her career Sacorra has developed skill sets in ADHD, mental health assessments, trauma informed care, Africentric therapy, psychodynamic therapy, mindfulness, and cognitive behavioral therapy and has worked with people who experience ADHD, executive functioning challenges, depression, anxiety, PTSD, self esteem/self awareness difficulties and, bipolar disorder. Her goal is to serve abused, neglected, and exploited persons from marginalized communities who are also underserved and underrepresented in mental health service delivery systems and mental health related research. Sacorra completed a Bachelor of Arts degree in Womenâ€™s Studies and Psychology as well as a minor in Child Development at Florida State University. She obtained a Masters in Community Psychology at Florida A&M University and was a member of the Alpha Kappa Mu Honor Society. Sacorraâ€™s post-graduate experiences helped her overall professional development by transforming the aspirational into the tangible; connecting her with people and support needed to facilitate cultural sensitive therapy. These experiences allowed her to develop valuable skills that will serve individuals from diverse backgrounds, experiencing a range of mental health issues such as depression, anxiety, PTSD, schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, self esteem/ self awareness difficulties, and various mood related disorders. Sacorra looks forward to serving you and your family by providing culturally sensitive person centered therapy.!

Dr. Kamaria Taylor-McCune, PhD, LPC is criminologist and forensic therapist specializing in the treatment of historical and pervasive racial trauma within the African-American community. She holds a Bachelor of Science in Psychology/Legal Studies, a Master of Arts in Forensic Psychology, a Master of Philosophy in Criminal Justice, and a Doctor of Philosophy in Criminal Justice. She is a Licensed Professional Counselor who works primarily in forensic settingsâ€”working with incarcerated citizens, returning citizens, and accountability court participants. In addition, Dr. K works with individuals who are struggling to find inner peace and balance due to historical trauma especially as it relates to the Black experience. Dr. K also assists her clients in understanding and managing stress and anxiety, depression, interpersonal relationship dynamics, and self-imagery. Dr. K primarily utilizes trauma-focused CBT (TF-CBT), person-centered, and solution-focused therapeutic modalities while also incorporating an eclectic treatment approaches to help clients reimagine themselves and their experiences. At MindFlower Group, Dr. K will provide counseling and therapy services soon.

Dr. Siobhan Gavins, LGPC, MFT, PhD is a Licensed Graduate Professional Counselor who has provided mental health services in the DMV for 7 years, specifically servicing District of Columbia residents. Siobhan is a DMV native who possesses a Masters of Arts in Marriage and Family Therapy and PhD in General Psychology. Siobhan has an abundance of experience in youth and family services as she has served as a Family and Youth Interventionist, a School Based Therapist, a Multi-systemic Therapist, and Community Support worker. Siobhan is able to provide an exemplary therapeutic experience for all clients as she is trained in various teaching models, family models, trauma informed care, social emotional learning, commercial sexual exploitation of children, and treating the whole person. Siobhan's has provided child, family, individual, and group therapy. Siobhan creates a therapeutic alliance with clients as she has performed all duties and tasks of therapy, including and not limited to intakes, diagnostic interviews, and the administration of pre-treatment assessments. Siobhan wholeheartedly believes that our behaviors are not solely an indication of who we are, but are an expression of what we need. Together, Siobhan seeks to help you obtain what you need so you may live in your happiest potential. At MindFlower Group, Ms. Gavins provides supervised counseling and therapy services.

Jessica Cetoute, LICSW Jessica is passionate about serving individuals to empower personal strengths and awareness so they can effectively navigate their life circumstances with clarity, calm, and harmony. Jessica is an intuitive holistic emotional wellness practitioner and social change advocate. She is excited to share her passion, commitment, and leadership expertise in serving individuals across the lifespan navigate complex trauma, chronic mental health and co-occurring challenges such as grief and loss, anxiety/stress, depression/mood disorders, Attention-deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD), addiction/impulsive behaviors, crime victim issues, developmental and intellectual disabilities, psychiatric rehabilitation supports, spiritual/religion burn-out/exploration, and child and family challenges. She tailors interventions specifically for the individual and draws from integrative trauma-informed, person-centered, spiritual-based therapeutic techniques, such as, mindfulness, body movement/yoga, expressive arts, cognitive behavioral, emotion and attachment focused, motivational interviewing, psychodynamic, psychoanalytical, and family systems. Jessica obtained her Masters in Social Work at Howard University and is a licensed clinical Social Worker in the District of Columbia and has dedicated over 15 years advocating for people that are vulnerable domestically and internationally. She is committed to making a positive change by advocating for marginalized populations and mental health systems. Jessica enjoys holistic wellness, having fun with family and friends, reading, eating delicious cuisines from around the world, and traveling. At MindFlower, Jessica provides counseling and therapy services and supervision.

Weelay Gonyon, LICSW is a Licensed Social Worker in Maryland and Washington D.C. Weelay has a Bachelors in Social Work from Shaw University and a Masters in Social Work from Clark Atlanta University. Weelay has experience working with children, individuals, and families struggling with trauma, grief and loss, anxiety, depression, self-esteem, life transitions and anger management. She uses Person Centered Therapy, Cognitive Behavioral Therapy and a solution focused approach when working with clients. Weelay enjoys helping clients use their uniqueness to find joy within, while offering mindfulness techniques and guidance to help each client meet their self-proclaimed goals. Weelay along with the client will create a safe place where the client can speak and share openly, free from judgment or shame while learning new skills to find healing and to live a healthier life.

Dominique Covington LPC-A With a foundation rooted in empathy and understanding, my therapeutic approach integrates various evidence-based

practices to foster holistic well-being. Drawing from Cognitive-Behavioral Therapy (CBT), I guide individuals into

identifying and challenging negative thought patterns, empowering them to cultivate healthier perspectives. I believe

in the transformative power of self-awareness and work collaboratively with clients to cultivate insight and resilience.

Incorporating elements of Psychodynamic Therapy, I explore the intricate connections between past experiences and

current emotions, unraveling the complexities that shape oneâ€™s worldview. My commitment to Client-Centered

Therapy ensures a collaborative and personalized experience. By fostering an open and non-judgmental space,

individuals feel empowered to explore their emotions and vulnerabilities. Solution-Focused Therapy adds a pragmatic

touch, emphasizing practical strategies and goal-oriented approaches to address specific challenges. I like to include

comedic relief along the process to disarm defenses and embrace the natural medicinal benefits of humor.

Furthermore, I embrace a strengths-based perspective, emphasizing and building upon individual strengths and

buoyancy. Integrating elements of narrative therapy, I assist clients in reframing their life stories, empowering them to

construct narratives that align with their current values and aspirations.

Including a multicultural lens, I am attuned to the diverse backgrounds and experiences of clients, promoting

inclusivity and cultural sensitivity. Through a dynamic and flexible therapeutic style, I strive to create a supportive

environment that fosters lasting personal growth and positive change.

My experience spans working with returning citizens facing various issues, limitations, and life transitions. I am

committed to continuous professional development, staying informed about the latest research and therapeutic

techniques to provide the most effective support. I am passionate about the work and ready to journey alongside my

clients.

Tanya Brown, LGSW, LMSW, MSW is a licensed Social Worker in Washington, D.C. and Maryland with a Master of Social Work degree from Tulane University. She is a member of Phi Alpha Honor Society and a board member and the membership chair of the International Council on Social Welfare US & Caribbean Chapter (ICSW). She has 4 years of experience in the mental health field including case management, community support and outreach for the homeless and previously incarcerated populations, crisis intervention, and providing intake and therapeutic services in an outpatient setting. Ms. Brown focuses on trauma, depression, and anxiety. Her approach is collaborative and she employs various therapeutic techniques including Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), Person-Centered Therapy, and Solution-Focused Brief Therapy (SFBT). Ms. Brown provides a safe, non-judgmental space for her clients to process their feelings, thoughts, and experiences as she helps to guide them on the path to healing and wellness. At MindFlower Group, Ms. Brown provides supervised counseling and therapy services.

Nicol Jackson LGPC Candidate, received her Masters of Arts degree in Counseling Psychology from Bowie State University in May 2021, and has a BA degree in African American Studies from the University of Maryland-College Park campus.

Nicol has experience working with individuals and children who have a variety of issues, such as feelings of sadness and depression, anxiety, social anxiety, anger, transition, identity issues, self-esteem, motivation, social skills, learning challenges, college and career future planning, decision-making, relationship issues, and loss. Nicol also has over 14 years of experience working with adult individuals with bipolar and other mood-related experiences, anxieties, self-image and self-harm concerns, and those who have had psychosis-related experiences. Nicol sees every person she works with as a unique, resilient individual whose life matters. Nicol feels that simply being present, using active listening, and building rapport is vital to utilizing therapeutic tools during the counseling process. As an eclectic counselor, Nicol integrates elements from approaches such as person-centered, cognitive behavioral, motivation interviewing, psychoanalytic, as well as utilize mindfulness exercises. At MindFlower Group, Nicol will provide supervised counseling and therapy services soon!
